cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north on Thursday–Friday and track northward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central/southeast Louisiana coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning currently in effect for Mexico from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Mexico coast Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle and Yucatán coast of Mexico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts of 30–45 mph possible late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor river surge possible along the lower Mississippi but significant surge unlikely at the port due to distance inland
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches could cause flash and river flooding in the Baton Rouge area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Flooded roadways, lightning, and possible operational delays due to high water levels on the Mississippi River
